intro: Catocoma altissima, commonly known as the tall catocoma, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its tall, woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
